intro: Vasconcellosia hastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved vasconcellosia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
